verses.roman:
koṭi-candra jini' mukha ujjvala-varaṇa
dāḍimba-bīja-sama danta tāmbūla-carvaṇa

synonyms: koṭi-candra—millions upon millions of moons; jini'-surpassing; mukha—face; ujjvala-varaṇa—bright and brilliant; dāḍimba-bīja—pomegranate seeds; sama—like; danta—teeth; tāmbūla-carvaṇa—chewing betel nut.
translation: His face was more beautiful than millions upon millions of moons, and His teeth were like pomegranate seeds because of His chewing betel.
